intro: Epidendrum erica-moroniae, commonly known as the Moronia Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are elongated,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. It requires bright, indirect light and moderate humidity to thrive in cultivation.
